intro: Goldfussia biceps, commonly known as the two-arm goldenflower, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with intricate patterns. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to tropical regions, it thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
